channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 14th August
item.description:
There are dead branches in the trees along the whole of Sydenham Road North, the trees are also incredibly high and have not been pollarded in years! We are concerned that a branch will break off and fall into our driveway damaging our vehicles
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 14th August
item.description:
PLEASE CUT BACK SO SIGN CAN BE CLEARLY SEEN 7m 2 WAY TRAFFIC LIGHTS NOT MARKED (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 14th August
item.description:
I am writing as a resident of Gloucester Road, between Churchdown and the Arle Court roundabout, in the section where the Gloucester/Cheltenham cycle lane was recently installed. Previously, this stretch of road had a 50mph limit. Following the cycle path installation, the speed limit was reduced to 30mph to improve safety for cyclists and to reflect the narrowing of the road. While the 50mph signs have been removed, no 30mph signs have been installed in their place. Although the 30mph limit may be implied by street lighting, most drivers continue to travel at higher speeds. Given that this road has been 50mph for over three decades, its wide layout, and relatively sparse housing, it is easy for drivers to assume a higher speed limit. I fully support the cycle lane, which I see used regularly, including by myself. However, the absence of clear 30mph signage is contributing to speeding, creating a real safety riskâ€”particularly at the junction with Bamfurlong Lane. I frequently observe vehicles, including HGVs, exceeding 30mph in this area, endangering cyclists and pedestrians. I strongly urge the installation of clear 30mph signage along the stretch between Churchdown and the start of the average speed camera on Gloucester Road, with particular attention to the Bamfurlong Lane junction which where I witness most of the safety hazards. This measure will significantly enhance safety for all road users. I would greatly appreciate being kept informed of the progress of this request.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
